title: The Watchtower and the Masons - Fritz Springmeier
description:
The Watchtower and The Masons - A Preliminary Investigation

Fritz Springmeier

A book outlining the connections between Freemasonry, Judaism, and the Jehovah's Witness of the Watchtower Bible and Tract Society. This is a great book that illustrates the Zionist backboning of Millenialist Christian movements in the early 1900s. Today the Jehovah's Witnesses are one of the most dangerous religious cults around. Their policies have killed many people and they have brainwashed and stolen the minds of millions.

Background
Once there was a Jewish family whose name was Roessel. They lived in early 17th century Germany. They moved to a country called Scotland. There they respelled the name Russell. They took on ways of their new homeland. The English tried to settle Protestants from Scotland and Ireland in order to the control the Irish.

The letter equates the Watchtower Society with the Jewish Zionist movement. Whether the two are actually the same or not, it is evident from this article, that the Watchtower leaders were not concerned that the Society and the Zionist movement be identified together.

More Connections to Jewish Banking
If suspicions are worth mentioning, I suspect that the Watchtower Society, which does business with Chemical Bank and Chase Manhattan, may play some money laundering role. They would be the perfect cover, and all their financial records have been extremely secret for most of this century.

Not only are they majority of Governing Body members of Jewish heritage, but some of the Society leaders hobnob with some of the financial Jewish elite. A couple of examples that were not in my Be Wise As Serpents book along this lune are as follows. Anton Koerber bought his way into the Watchtower Society hierarchy. He gave the WT. Soc. President a Cadillac. He sent a donation for $2,000 to The Dawn, a splinter group from the WT, and requested a meeting with their trustees. He tried to get this splinter group to establish them into an organization like the Watchtower Society which they rejected. In 1953, in appreciation for his money, the WT Society made Anton Koerber chairman of the International Convention at Yankee Stadium. The parents of S.S. For a while the London office and British Guinea were loyal to Johnson rather than Rutherford. But Rutherford tricked the law into believing that the four Directors who opposed him were illegal, and forced their dismissal. Then he had the upper hand.
